summary:
Throughout all my working experiences I have been fascinated by putting my creativity in professional outings. I started my career in the event industry, where I organised and hosted many events in the cultural industry and nightlife industry.

With my educational background in business development, I ended up doing a lot of management work. this included managing websites, social media and email campaigns. Gradually my interest for design and copywriting grew. When Covid hit I decided to change my career and become a full time webdesigner. 
‍
I believe what makes me unique as a webdesigner is my experience and knowledge of marketing and business development. With these skills I’m able to design user-centered websites that follow real-life customer journeys and ultimately turn your visitors into happy customers. I’m truly fascinated by the many layers design offers, and how it can be used as a powerful tool to communicate with your audience. 

How I can help you:

WEBDESIGN 
With my background in business I design purposeful websites that will appeal to your audience, engage them with your brand, and ultimately turn them into happy customers. 

WEB DEVELOPMENT
I build custom responsive websites that will function on any device. My main tool for this is Webflow, but I am familiar with most development platforms out there. 

COPYWRITING & SEO
Everyone can write copy, but it's a whole different thing to write compelling copy that engages the readers, generates thoughts and ultimately prompts them to action. On top I will optimise your copy to get you high up in the results of search engines like Google.

CREATIVE DIRECTION
Wether you are looking for a complete rebranding, a photoshoot or setting up a new marketing campaign, I am here to help. I have a broad network of professional creatives and lot’s of experience in project management.

For more information about me and my services, have a look at my website www.jessereinier.com

education.field_of_study: Mathematics (A+B) | Physics | Science | Biology | Informatics | English | Dutch | French

profile_positions.description:
With my educational background in business development, I ended up doing a lot of digital management work. this included managing websites, social media and email campaigns. Gradually my interest for design and copywriting grew. When Covid hit I decided to change my career and become a full time webdesigner. 
‍
I believe what makes me unique as a webdesigner is my experience and knowledge of marketing and business development. With these skills I’m able to design user-centered websites that follow real-life customer journeys and ultimately turn your visitors into happy customers. I’m fascinated by the many layers design offers, and how it can be used as a powerful tool to communicate with your audience.
profile_positions.title: Webdesigner | Web developer | Copywriter

profile_positions.description:
Throughout all my working experiences I have been fascinated by putting my creativity in marketing outings - from online campaigns to physical ones. The combination of my organisational skills and my creative marketing experience, have brought me to starting as a freelancer and gave me the opportunity to collaborate with clients such as Absolut Vodka, Warsteiner, Eventcare, Club Atelier and many more. 

I am always down for a chat, whether this is for new opportunities, giving advice, or just to share thoughts about new ideas and concepts. So let’s get in touch!
profile_positions.title: Creative Marketeer | Project & Event Manager

profile_positions.description:
After taking on freelance supervising jobs for a while at event location Atelier Schinkel, I had the opportunity to take over the former Operations Manager at the end of 2019. The tasks of the Operations Manager include managing the staff, contractors, budgets, sales, marketing and maintaining hygiene and improvements of the venue itself - meaning I am the main point of contact for clients, colleagues and other stakeholders at all time. 

in 2020, Atelier opened their second venue, in which I helped recruiting staff and doing sales. To make this all work properly I am helped setting up (digital management) systems for internal communication that work between both venues.
profile_positions.title: Event Operations Manager | Sales Manager

profile_positions.description:
Stichting Stem van de Nacht connects established cultural institutions to a wide array of young creators, presenting their projects to the general public with complete artistic freedom. By curating a contemporary art program throughout diverse venues in uncommon areas in Amsterdam, the foundation aims to bridge the gap that as of today still continues to exist between the art scene and new generation residents of our city. 

After founding the foundation, I became the Foundation Director. Being a small foundation, our direction team collaborated closely on developing and executing projects (including ODAM and FYWP) in Amsterdam. My main tasks were managing the general operations, managing the marketing campaigns, and producing the events. Working on this position I had the chance to develop a broad variety of skill sets related to business management & development, marketing, event management and project management.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder | Foundation Director | Operations Manager | Event Manager | Marketing Director

profile_positions.description:
Blend Int. was a collective of eight entrepreneurs, all studying at Team Academy Amsterdam. The purpose of the collective was to develop projects together, support each other, gain experience and and entrepreneurial competences and to share knowledge. Together we have travelled the world to learn from different business cultures and run projects abroad. 

Our latest project was based in South Africa and the Netherlands, where we offer “24 hour challenges” to companies and NGO's. Within 24 hour we’d solve a problem or a case, whereafter we present our outcome with a detailed document. In the past we have provided this service to companies such as Makro Nederland, co working space B.Amsterdam and I&J Fishery Cape Town.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder | Project Manager | Consultant

profile_positions.description: Travable was a passion and study project of two friends who wanted to travel Peru and develop sustainable culinary tours to finance the trip while further developing our entrepreneurial skills. We collaborated with local farmers, chefs and tour operators in South America and marketed these tours in the Netherlands. All tours were co-created with local communities in order to support them financially and sustain their cultural and natural heritages.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder | Marketing Director | Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Bobbin&Fly was a platform for upcoming artists in Amsterdam, organizing monthly events for them to showcase their music and artworks in venues around town. In 2016, Bobbin&Fly fused with HUIS! into Stichting Stem van de Nacht after a successful collaboration.

The company was founded by Alex Hersee and myself. Or goal was to support local artists and create space for them in the overwhelming musical and creative scene of Amsterdam, in which it’s difficult for upcoming artists to get foothold without the needed marketing skills and network.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder | Operations Manager | Marketing Director | Event Manager

profile_positions.description: I Joined this pharmaceutical startup to help develop and innovate their core product to fit the needs of the target audience and create a sustainable business model around it. My main role was to lay out a path for development and financing the project, which was a long but educational trajectory. I had the chance to develop my project management skills, including budgeting, strategic planning, risk management, lean methods and more.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Business Development
